uk.ac.uea.mathsthing

Interface IFormulaLexer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IObservable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Lexer

    public interface IFormulaLexer
extends IObservable
    Provides methods that will allow a lexer to accept and tokenise a provided mathematical formula. Calling tokenize() will create a String array containing the tokens found in a formula.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jordan Woerner

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getParameters()
      Returns a mapping of parameters found in a formula.
      java.lang.String getProccessedFormula()
      Get the formula the user provided once it has been processed to include any extra operators that the parser will need (such as implied multiplications).
      Token[] getTokens()
      Returns the tokens created by this lexer if they exist.
      java.lang.String getUserFormula()
      Get the formula the user provided to this instance, as written before any processing was performed.
      void setForumla(java.lang.String formula)
      Sets the formula to be tokenised.
      Token[] tokenize()
      Analyse and tokenise a provided formula.

      • Methods inherited from interface uk.ac.uea.mathsthing.util.IObservable

        attach, detach, update

    • Method Detail

      • getUserFormula

        java.lang.String getUserFormula()
        Get the formula the user provided to this instance, as written before any processing was performed.
        Returns:
        The formula provided by the user as a String.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getProccessedFormula

        java.lang.String getProccessedFormula()
        Get the formula the user provided once it has been processed to include any extra operators that the parser will need (such as implied multiplications).
        Returns:
        A String containing the processed formula.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setForumla

        void setForumla(java.lang.String formula)
        Sets the formula to be tokenised.
        Parameters:
        formula - A String representation of the formula.
        Since:
        1.0

      • tokenize

        Token[] tokenize()
        Analyse and tokenise a provided formula. The tokens will contain constants, paramters, functions and operators.
        Returns:
        A String array containing all the tokens found in the formula.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTokens

        Token[] getTokens()
        Returns the tokens created by this lexer if they exist. The tokens will contain constants, paramters, functions and operators.
        Returns:
        Returns a String array containing the tokens of a processed formula.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getParameters

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getParameters()
        Returns a mapping of parameters found in a formula. Mapping contains a mapping of a operand to a constant to replace it with.
        Returns:
        A HashMap of String to Double for each parameter found in the formula being parsed.
        Since:
        1.0
